The Corona-crisis and getting to the globalisation we need

The Coronavirus outbreak is one of the most urgent and existential global challenges our world has seen in generations. Like nothing before it, it has shown how economically, technologically, politically and environmentally interconnected our world is. We do need to reinvent how globalisation works, and place active citizenship at its core.

Voxeurop is the first European Press Cooperative – owned by journalists, translators, and readers in 16 countries.

The golden egg

Rainer Hachfeld - Neues Deutschland (Berlin)

Ideas

What crisis if the EU did not exist?

Faced with the initial lack of solidarity among European states while the epidemic ravaged Italy, a number of people criticised the Union’s inertia, even calling for its dissolution. But what would be the impact of this crisis if the EU did not exist Economist and historian Thierry Vissol attempts to answer.

 Thierry Vissol

A new website for informing on a European scale

Voxeurop editorial board

Ideas

What kind of post-corona world do Europeans want?

The current epidemic is bringing political tightening, economic downturn and social disruption, but it might also be an opportunity for radical change towards a more fair, democratic, and open Europe, says Timothy Garton Ash.

 Timothy Garton Ash
